page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO THE AREA.
page.content: THIS AREA TAKES THE EASTERN BOUNDARY OF REDDITCH NEW TOWN AND A FARMING AREA OF WARWICKSHIRE. THE REDDITCH SECTION COMPRISES OF PLANNED ESTATES OF SMALL HOUSES _ DETACHED AND SEMI_ DETACHED AND FACTORY UNITS BOTH ENTERPRISE AND LARGER UNITS. A ROAD AND A SCREEN OF TREES FORM A BARRIER BETWEEN REDDITCH AND THE REST OF THE AREA. THIS TOO IS THE COUNTY BOUNDARY. TO THE RIGHT OF THE ROAD A435 ARE TWO GARDEN CENTRES SPECIALISING IN ROSES. THE REST OF THE AREA IS FARMLAND. THE FARMS FALL INTO TWO CATAGORIES: 1) OWNER OCCUPIED ABOUT 300 ACRES _ STOCK AND ARABLE 2) OWNED BY A ABSENTEE LANDLORD _ ARABLE ONLY. STUDLEY CASTLE IS THE BRITISH LEYLAND SALES COLLEGE.{
